document.masterDocTitle: A checklist of the amphibians and reptiles of Honduras, with additions, comments on taxonomy, some recent taxonomic decisions, and areas of further studies needed

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A checklist of the amphibians and reptiles of Honduras, with additions, comments on taxonomy, some recent taxonomic decisions, and areas of further studies needed

subSubSection.paragraph:
( 27 genera, 62 species, 1 endemic genus, 12 endemic species).
Vidal et al. ( 2007 )
, in an influential publication regarding the Caenophidia, erroneously credited
Bonaparte ( 1840 )
for introducing the name Dipsadidae . However, the correct publication for that family name should be
Bonaparte ( 1838 , as Dipsadina)
.
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
also cited that incorrect Bonaparte publication.

Clelia Fitzinger 1826
, 29 ( 1 species)
Clelia clelia
(Daudin 1803 c, 330 )

Coniophanes Hallowell 1860
, 248 in Cope 1860 ( 4 species)
Coniophanes bipunctatus
(Günther 1858, 36 )

Coniophanes imperialis
(Baird & Girard
1859, 23 in
Baird 1859 )
Coniophanes piceivittis Cope 1870
, 149

Conophis lineatus
(A.M.C. Duméril, Bibron & Duméril 1854 b, 936 )

Cubophis
Hedges & Vidal 2009
, 14 in
Hedges et al. 2009
( 1 species, 1 endemic species)

Cubophis brooksi
(E) (Barbour 1914, 333 ). Despite saying they were documenting all name changes subsequent to the
McCranie ( 2009 )
list,
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
did not note that
McCranie ( 2011 a)
resurrected this species name from the synonymy of
C. cantherigerus
(Bibron 1840 [plate XXVII] in de la Sagra
1838–1843
).

Enuliophis McCranie & Villa 1993
, 262 ( 1 species).
Myers & McDowell ( 2014 )
suggested placing this genus in the synonymy of
Enulius
. The four species of
Enulius
(following
Wallach et al . 2014
) are the only New World dipsadines known to have the entire hemipenis covered with minute, uniform spinules. Placing
Enuliophis
, with its large hemipenial spines, in the synonymy of
Enulius
would eliminate that synapomorphy for
Enulius
.

Enulius Cope 1871
, 558 ( 3 species, 2 endemic species)
Enulius bifoveatus
(E) McCranie & Köhler 1999, 15
Enulius flavitorques
(Cope 1869, 307 )

Erythrolamprus F. Boie 1827
, col. 981 ( 1 species).
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
listed 1826 as the date of publication for the description of this genus.

Geophis damiani
(E) Wilson, McCranie & Williams 1998, 410
Geophis fulvoguttatus Mertens 1952
, 134

Geophis nephodrymus
(E) Townsend & Wilson 2006, 151
Geophis rhodogaster
(Cope 1868, 130 )

Imantodes gemmistratus Cope 1862
, 296.
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
listed the date 1861 for this Cope publication.
Imantodes inornatus Boulenger 1896
, 88

Leptodeira rhombifera
(Günther 1872, 32 ). Despite saying they were documenting all name changes subsequent to the
McCranie ( 2009 )
list,
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
did not note that
McCranie ( 2011 a)
resurrected this species name from the synonymy of
L. annulata
(Linnaeus 1758 [p. 224 ]).

Leptodeira septentrionalis
(Kennicott
1859, 16 in
Baird 1859 ). This widespread nominal form is apparently a complex of several species (see recent brief discussion in
McCranie 2011 a
).

Ninia pavimentata
(Bocourt
1883, 549 in
A.H.A. Duméril et al.
1870–1909
)
Ninia sebae
(A.M.C. Duméril, Bibron & Duméril 1854 a, 515 )

Nothopsis Cope 1871
, 201 ( 1 species)
Nothopsis rugosus Cope 1871
, 201

Omoadiphas
(E) Köhler, Wilson & McCranie 2001, 270 ( 3 endemic species)
Omoadiphas aurula
(E) Köhler, Wilson & McCranie 2001, 271

Pliocercus elapoides Cope 1860
, 253
Pliocercus euryzonus Cope 1862
, 72

Rhadinella H. Smith 1941
, 7 ( 7 species, 2 endemic species)

Rhadinella godmani
(Günther 1865, 94 ). This nominal form appears to be a complex of several species occurring in isolated, montane localities.

Rhadinella lachrymans
(Cope 1870, 154 ). The Honduran population assigned to this species appears to represent an undescribed species. Tissues are available.

Rhadinella pegosalyta
(E) (
McCranie 2006, 528
)
Rhadinella tolpanorum
(E) (Holm & Cruz D. 1994, 17 )

, 29 ( 8 species, 2 endemic species)

(Günther 1872, 30 )

(Stejneger 1909, 457 )

(E)
McCranie 2007
, 213

McCranie 2006

Sibon nebulatus
(Linnaeus 1758, 222 )

Tretanorhinus A.M.C. Duméril, Bibron & Duméril 1854
a, 348 ( 1 species).
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
“mistyped” the date of this publication as 1954 .
